title: Setting up your Distill blog
description: How to set up your distill blog like I did.
contents:
Contents
1. Create a distill blog project
2. Build website
3. Create Git repository
4. Publish your repository
5. Configure Github Pages

1. Create a distill blog project
Open up Rstudio
File -> New Project -> Open in New Directory -> Distill Blog


Use hyphens in the directory name instead of spaces to match github conventions
check both boxes

2. Build website
build -> build website

3. Create Git repository
open up GitHub desktop client for mac.
click add an existing repository


Choose the directory you created for your Rproject and hit add repository
This will give an error and a different option, to create a repository there instead, click that


Do not initialize a readme. Choose a license if you prefer.
Give a description


4. Publish your repository
You will need to make your you have a github account and sign in beforehand
hit publish


Uncheck the box and publish

5. Configure Github Pages
Click open in github from the desktop client. This brings you to your github page.
Go to settings


Scroll to the bottom
Change the source to main, and the folder to docs
click Save


Wait until the blue background turns green
Click the link to your websiteâ€™s URL


The Hello World page of your blog

Learn more about using Distill at https://rstudio.github.io/distill.

title: Welcome to Commercial Data Science
description:
Welcome to our new blog, Commercial Data Science. We hope you enjoy 
reading what we have to say!
